Ratios with Money

Mission 03: Ratios with Money

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A Tutorial Gate has been detected. Difficulty: E-Rank. Hunter, prepare to master the Currency Realm.

The Challenge Awaits

Welcome to the Tutorial Gate: Currency Realm, Hunter! In this dimension, you'll learn one of the most valuable skills any adventurer can possess - understanding how ratios and percentages work with money.

Every successful Hunter needs to manage their gold! Whether you're calculating quest rewards, splitting loot with your party, or determining what percentage of a treasure horde you've claimed - these skills are essential.

Today, you'll run your own mini-business where you earn money for completing physical tasks. The catch? You need to track your earnings using unit rates and calculate your success as a percentage!

‚öîÔ∏è Hunter Equipment

Gather these items before entering the dungeon: - Set of play money (your training gold) - Five dice (to randomize challenges) - Paper and pencil (for your earnings ledger)

üìú Skills to Unlock

6.RP.3b - I can solve unit rate problems. (Ex: If it took 7 hours to mow 4 lawns, then at that rate, how many lawns could be mowed in 35 hours? At what rate were the lawns being mowed?)

6.RP.3c - I can find a percent of a quantity as a rate per 100. (Ex: 30% of a quantity means 30/100 times the quantity)

6.RP.3c - I can solve problems involving finding the whole if I am given a part and the percent.

Understanding Ratios: A Hunter's Economics Guide

What is a Unit Rate?

A unit rate tells you the cost or value of ONE unit of something. It's your baseline measurement!

  • $2 per jumping jack means for every 1 jumping jack, you earn $2
  • $15 per hour means for every 1 hour of work, you earn $15
  • 60 miles per hour means for every 1 hour of driving, you travel 60 miles

Hunter Tip: To find ANY amount, multiply the unit rate by the quantity! - 10 jumping jacks √ó $2 = $20 - 5 hours √ó $15/hour = $75 - 3 hours √ó 60 mph = 180 miles

What is a Percentage?

A percentage is just another way to write a ratio where the total is always 100!

  • 50% = 50 out of 100 = 50/100 = 0.50 = half
  • 25% = 25 out of 100 = 25/100 = 0.25 = one quarter
  • 100% = 100 out of 100 = the whole thing!

The Percentage Formula:

Percentage = (Part / Whole) √ó 100

If you did 34 out of 50 possible jumping jacks: - 34 √∑ 50 = 0.68 - 0.68 √ó 100 = 68%

üè∞ Dungeon Raid

üìú Official Quest Instructions

We are going to make a chart for keeping track of how much you are going to earn doing something. In my example it will be jumping jacks, but feel free to switch it to something you love doing (like shooting a basket) or need to do (pick up toys). You are going to do "jumping jacks" at a rate of $2/per jumping jack. So for every jumping jack you do, you get $2 (in your money kit). Make a chart to figure out how much money you will get if you do a certain amount of jumping jacks. It will look like this:

Jumping Jacks Money
1 $2
2 $4

How much money will you make if you do 10, 16 and 32 jumping jacks? Do as many jumping jacks as you can up to 50. How many did you do? How much money did you earn? If you did all 50 you would have earned $100. You earned some part of the $100 possible. If you did 34 jumping jacks and got $68 then you got 68/100 of the possible amount or 68%. What percent of the possible did you get?

CK12 Account Setup (for online activities)

To create a CK12 account: 1. Go to: https://www.ck12.org/student/ 2. Click on the orange JOIN button in the upper right corner 3. Choose the option for email to sign up 4. Enter your student's information. CK12 will ask for teacher email - ENTER THE TEACHER'S EMAIL 5. When complete, the teacher will email you the username and password

üí° Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Create Your Earnings Chart

Draw a two-column table on your paper: | Jumping Jacks | Money Earned | |---------------|--------------| | 1 | $2 | | 2 | $4 | | 3 | $6 | | ... | ... |

Step 2: Calculate Target Amounts

Use your unit rate ($2 per jack) to fill in these specific amounts: - 10 jacks: 10 √ó $2 = $20 - 16 jacks: 16 √ó $2 = $32 - 32 jacks: 32 √ó $2 = $64

Step 3: The Physical Challenge

Now it's time to MOVE! Do as many jumping jacks as you can (up to 50 maximum). - Count carefully! - Take breaks if needed - accuracy matters more than speed

Step 4: Calculate Your Earnings

When you're done, calculate your total earnings: - Your jumping jacks √ó $2 = Your earnings - Example: 34 jacks √ó $2 = $68

Step 5: Calculate Your Percentage

This is the key math skill! Determine what percentage of the maximum you achieved:

Percentage = (Your Jacks / 50) √ó 100

Example: (34 / 50) √ó 100 = 68%

This means you earned 68% of the maximum possible reward!

Step 6: Count Out Your Play Money

Physically count out your earned amount from your play money set. This makes the math REAL!

üëë Guild Master Verification

STOP! üõë Summon your Guild Master (Parent/Guardian) for verification.

Guild Master Instructions:

Your young Hunter has completed the Currency Realm challenge. Verify their calculations:

  • [ ] Check their math: (Number of Jacks) √ó $2 = Correct earnings?
  • [ ] Verify percentage calculation: (Jacks / 50) √ó 100 = Correct %?
  • [ ] If they did 34 jacks: Pay = $68, Percentage = 68%
  • [ ] Do they understand that 50 jacks = 100% = $100?
  • [ ] Did they complete the verbatim quest instructions in Section 4?
  • [ ] Did they review at least one Training Scroll (video)?
